app_description: A fast and secure browser for standalone virtual-reality and augmented-reality headsets

app_ids.name: org.mozilla.vrbrowser
app_ids.description: A fast and secure browser for standalone virtual-reality and augmented-reality headsets

pings.description:
This ping is intended to provide metrics that are managed by the library
itself, and not explicitly set by the application or included in the
application's `metrics.yaml` file.
The `baseline` ping is automatically sent when the application is moved to
the background.

reasons.active:
The ping was submitted when the application became active again, which
includes when the application starts. In earlier versions, this was called
`foreground`.

*Note*: this ping will not contain the `glean.baseline.duration` metric.
reasons.dirty_startup:
The ping was submitted at startup, because the application process was
killed before the Glean SDK had the chance to generate this ping, before
becoming inactive, in the last session.

*Note*: this ping will not contain the `glean.baseline.duration` metric.
reasons.inactive:
The ping was submitted when becoming inactive. In earlier versions, this
was called `background`.

pings.name: baseline

pings.description: A ping sent for every bookmarks sync. It doesn't include the `client_id` because it reports a hashed version of the user's Firefox Account ID.
pings.name: bookmarks-sync

pings.description:
This ping is submitted when a user opts out of
sending technical and interaction data to Mozilla.
This ping is intended to communicate to the Data Pipeline
that the user wishes to have their reported Telemetry data deleted.
As such it attempts to send itself at the moment the user
opts out of data collection.

reasons.at_init:
The ping was submitted at startup.
Glean discovered that between the last time it was run and this time,
upload of data has been disabled.
reasons.set_upload_enabled:
The ping was submitted between Glean init and Glean shutdown.
Glean was told after init but before shutdown that upload has changed
from enabled to disabled.

pings.name: deletion-request

pings.description:
The events ping's purpose is to transport all of the event metric
information. The `events` ping is automatically sent when the application
becomes inactive.

reasons.inactive:
The ping was submitted when becoming inactive. In earlier versions, this
was called `background`.
reasons.max_capacity: The maximum number of events was reached (default 500 events).
reasons.startup:
The ping was submitted at startup. The events ping is always sent if there
are any pending events at startup, because event timestamps can not be
mixed across runs of the application.

pings.name: events

pings.description: A ping sent for every history sync. It doesn't include the `client_id` because it reports a hashed version of the user's Firefox Account ID.
pings.name: history-sync

pings.description: A ping sent for every logins/passwords sync. It doesn't include the `client_id` because it reports a hashed version of the user's Firefox Account ID.
pings.name: logins-sync

pings.description:
The `metrics` ping is intended for all of the metrics that are explicitly
set by the application or are included in the application's `metrics.yaml`
file (except events).
The reported data is tied to the ping's *measurement window*, which is the
time between the collection of two `metrics` ping. Ideally, this window is
expected to be about 24 hours, given that the collection is scheduled daily
at 4AM. Data in the `ping_info` section of the ping can be used to infer the
length of this window.

reasons.overdue:
The last ping wasn't submitted on the current calendar day, but it's after
4am, so this ping submitted immediately
reasons.reschedule:
A ping was just submitted. This ping was rescheduled for the next calendar
day at 4am.
reasons.today:
The last ping wasn't submitted on the current calendar day, but it is
still before 4am, so schedule to send this ping on the current calendar
day at 4am.
reasons.tomorrow:
The last ping was already submitted on the current calendar day, so
schedule this ping for the next calendar day at 4am.
reasons.upgrade:
This ping was submitted at startup because the application was just
upgraded.

pings.name: metrics

pings.description: This ping is sent at the end of a session (when Firefox Reality switches to the background). We usually send search and UI control metrics at the end of a session.
pings.name: session-end

pings.description: A summary ping, sent every time a sync is performed. During each Sync one or more data types could be synchronized, depending on which data types user configured to sync. Alongside with 'sync' ping one or more individual data type specific pings will be sent. For example, if history and bookmarks data types are configured to be synchronized, the following pings will be sent: 'sync', 'history-sync' and 'bookmarks-sync'. Alternatively, if only history is configured to be synchronized then 'sync' and 'history-sync' pings will be sent. In case of a "global failure" where none of the data type syncs could even start, e.g. device is offline, only the 'sync' ping will be sent. This ping doesn't include the `client_id` because it reports a hashed version of the user's Firefox Account ID.
pings.name: sync

metrics.name: android_sdk_version
metrics.description:
The optional Android specific SDK version of the software running on this
hardware device.

metrics.name: app_build
metrics.description:
The build identifier generated by the CI system (e.g. "1234/A").
For language bindings that provide automatic detection for this value,
(e.g. Android/Kotlin), in the unlikely event that the build identifier
can not be retrieved from the OS, it is set to "inaccessible". For other
language bindings, if the value was not provided through configuration,
this metric gets set to `Unknown`.

metrics.name: app_channel
metrics.description: The channel the application is being distributed on.

metrics.name: app_display_version
metrics.description:
The user visible version string (e.g. "1.0.3").

In the unlikely event that the display version can not be retrieved,
it is set to "inaccessible".

metrics.name: architecture
metrics.description: The architecture of the device, (e.g. "arm", "x86").

metrics.name: bookmarks_sync.failure_reason
metrics.description: Records bookmark sync failure reasons.

metrics.name: bookmarks_sync.finished_at
metrics.description: Records when the bookmark sync finished.

metrics.name: bookmarks_sync.incoming
metrics.description: Records incoming bookmark record counts.

metrics.name: bookmarks_sync.outgoing
metrics.description: Records outgoing bookmark record counts.

metrics.name: bookmarks_sync.outgoing_batches
metrics.description: Records the number of batches needed to upload all outgoing records.

metrics.name: bookmarks_sync.remote_tree_problems
metrics.description: Records counts for structure problems and divergences in the remote bookmarks tree. These are documented in https://github.com/mozilla/dogear/blob/fbade15f2a4f11215e30b8f428a0a8df3defeaec/src/tree.rs#L1273-L1294.

metrics.name: bookmarks_sync.started_at
metrics.description: Records when the bookmark sync started.

metrics.name: bookmarks_sync.uid
metrics.description: The user's hashed Firefox Account ID.

metrics.name: client_id
metrics.description: A UUID uniquely identifying the client.

metrics.name: control.open_new_window
metrics.description: Counting how many general windows are opened in a session.

metrics.name: device_manufacturer
metrics.description:
The manufacturer of the device the application is running on.
Not set if the device manufacturer can't be determined (e.g. on Desktop).

metrics.name: device_model
metrics.description:
The model of the device the application is running on.
On Android, this is Build.MODEL, the user-visible marketing name,
like "Pixel 2 XL".
Not set if the device model can't be determined (e.g. on Desktop).

metrics.name: distribution.channel_name
metrics.description: The distribution channel name of this application. We use this field to recognize Firefox Reality is distributed to which channels, such as wavevrStore, oculusvr, picovr,etc.

metrics.name: end_time
metrics.description:
The time of the end of collection of the data in the ping,
in local time and with minute precision, including timezone information.
This is also the time this ping was generated
and is likely well before ping transmission time.

metrics.name: experiments
metrics.description: Optional. A dictionary of active experiments.

metrics.name: firefox_account.bookmarks_sync_status
metrics.description: Bookmarks sync engine status. True means that the bookmarks sync status is enabled, false otherwise.

metrics.name: firefox_account.history_sync_status
metrics.description: History sync engine status. True means that the history sync status is enabled, false otherwise.

metrics.name: firefox_account.received_tab
metrics.description: Number of received tabs per day

metrics.name: firefox_account.sign_in
metrics.description: The user starts the sign in flow

metrics.name: firefox_account.sign_in_result
metrics.description: The user finishes the sign in flow

state.description: The result of the sign in flow. True in case of success, false in case of error

metrics.name: firefox_account.sign_out
metrics.description: A user pressed the sign out button on the sync account page and was successfully signed out of FxA

metrics.name: firefox_account.tab_sent
metrics.description: Number of tabs successfully sent per day

metrics.name: first_run_date
metrics.description: The date of the first run of the application.

metrics.name: fxa_tab.received
metrics.description: Recorded when a tab is received.  Also sent by desktop - see also the docs at https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/toolkit/components/telemetry/data/sync-ping.html

flow_id.description: A guid, unique for the URL being sent but common for all target devices.

reason.description: The reason we discovered the tab. Will be one of 'push', 'push-missed' or 'poll'.

stream_id.description: A guid, unique for both the URL being sent and the target device.

metrics.name: fxa_tab.sent
metrics.description: Recorded when a tab is sent. Also sent by desktop - see also the docs at https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/toolkit/components/telemetry/data/sync-ping.html

flow_id.description: A guid, unique for the URL being sent but common for all target devices. The value is randomly generated so can not identify details about the user or tab.

stream_id.description: A guid, unique for both the URL being sent and the target device. The value is randomly generated so can not identify details about the user or tab.

metrics.name: glean.baseline.duration
metrics.description: The duration of the last foreground session.

metrics.name: glean.baseline.locale
metrics.description:
The locale of the application during initialization (e.g. "es-ES").
If the locale can't be determined on the system, the value is
["und"](https://unicode.org/reports/tr35/#Unknown_or_Invalid_Identifiers),
to indicate "undetermined".

metrics.name: glean.core.migration.successful
metrics.description: Reports `true` if the client was successfully migrated from the Android-specific implementation of the Glean SDK to the cross-platform one.

metrics.name: glean.database.size
metrics.description: The size of the database file at startup.

metrics.name: glean.error.invalid_label
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a metric was set with an invalid label.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

metrics.name: glean.error.invalid_overflow
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a metric was set a value that overflowed.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

metrics.name: glean.error.invalid_state
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a timing metric was used incorrectly.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

metrics.name: glean.error.invalid_value
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times a metric was set to an invalid value.
The labels are the `category.name` identifier of the metric.

metrics.name: glean.error.io
metrics.description:
The number of times we encountered an IO error
when writing a pending ping to disk.

metrics.name: glean.error.preinit_tasks_overflow
metrics.description:
The number of tasks queued in the pre-initialization buffer.
Only sent if the buffer overflows.

metrics.name: glean.error.preinit_tasks_timeout
metrics.description: Set to true if the tasks that are queued prior to Glean initialization time out.

metrics.name: glean.time.invalid_timezone_offset
metrics.description:
Counts the number of times we encountered an invalid timezone offset
when trying to get the current time.
A timezone offset is invalid if it is outside [-24h, +24h].
If invalid a UTC offset is used (+0h).

metrics.name: glean.upload.deleted_pings_after_quota_hit
metrics.description:
The number of pings deleted after the quota
for the size of the pending pings directory or number of files is hit.
Since quota is only calculated for the pending pings directory,
and deletion request ping live in a different directory,
deletion request pings are never deleted.

metrics.name: glean.upload.discarded_exceeding_pings_size
metrics.description: The size of pings that exceeded the maximum ping size allowed for upload.

metrics.name: glean.upload.pending_pings
metrics.description:
The total number of pending pings at startup.
This does not include deletion-request pings.

metrics.name: glean.upload.pending_pings_directory_size
metrics.description:
The size of the pending pings directory upon initialization of Glean.
This does not include the size of the deletion request pings directory.

metrics.name: glean.upload.ping_upload_failure
metrics.description:
Counts the number of ping upload failures, by type of failure.
This includes failures for all ping types,
though the counts appear in the next successfully sent `metrics` ping.

metrics.name: glean.validation.app_forceclosed_count
metrics.description: This metric counts how many times a dirty bit was detected when starting the Glean SDK, on Android. This dirty bit is set to `true` when Android's lifecycle `ON_START` is hit and flipped back to false on `ON_STOP`. When an application is force-closed, it might not get the `ON_STOP` and so the value would stay `true`. The next time Glean starts, it will increment this counter.

metrics.name: glean.validation.baseline_ping_count
metrics.description: The number of baseline pings sent during the lifetime of this metrics ping.

metrics.name: glean.validation.first_run_hour
metrics.description: The hour of the first run of the application.

metrics.name: glean.validation.foreground_count
metrics.description: On mobile, the number of times the application went to foreground.

metrics.name: glean.validation.metrics_ping_count
metrics.description: The number of metrics pings sent during the lifetime of this baseline ping.

metrics.name: glean.validation.pings_submitted
metrics.description:
A count of the pings submitted, by ping type.

This metric appears in both the metrics and baseline pings.

- On the metrics ping, the counts include the number of pings sent since
  the last metrics ping (including the last metrics ping)
- On the baseline ping, the counts include the number of pings send since
  the last baseline ping (including the last baseline ping)

metrics.name: history_sync.failure_reason
metrics.description: Records why the history sync failed: either due to an authentication error, unexpected exception, or other error. The error strings are truncated and sanitized to omit PII, like URLs and file system paths.

metrics.name: history_sync.finished_at
metrics.description: Records when the history sync finished. This includes the time to download, apply, and upload all records.

metrics.name: history_sync.incoming
metrics.description: Records incoming history record counts. `applied` is the number of incoming history pages that were successfully stored or updated in the local database. `failed_to_apply` is the number of pages that were ignored due to errors. `reconciled` is the number of pages with new visits locally and remotely, and had their visits merged.

metrics.name: history_sync.outgoing
metrics.description: Records outgoing history record counts. `uploaded` is the number of records that were successfully sent to the server. `failed_to_upload` is the number of records that weren't uploaded, and will be retried on the next sync.

metrics.name: history_sync.outgoing_batches
metrics.description: Records the number of batches needed to upload all outgoing records. The Sync server has a hard limit on the number of records (and request body bytes) on the number of records that can fit into a single batch, and large syncs may require multiple batches.

metrics.name: history_sync.started_at
metrics.description: Records when the history sync started.

metrics.name: history_sync.uid
metrics.description: The user's hashed Firefox Account ID.

metrics.name: immersive.duration
metrics.description: Measuring if users use WebXR APIs to enter XR immersive mode. How long they stay in this mode. (It starts from users call `navigator.xr.requestSession()` and be ended when the XRSession calls its `end()`.)

metrics.name: legacy_telemetry.client_id
metrics.description: A UUID uniquely identifying the legacy telemetry client id. This is used for supporting legacy telemetry in the `deletion-request` ping.

metrics.name: locale
metrics.description:
The locale of the application during initialization (e.g. "es-ES").
If the locale can't be determined on the system, the value is
["und"](https://unicode.org/reports/tr35/#Unknown_or_Invalid_Identifiers),
to indicate "undetermined".

metrics.name: logins_sync.failure_reason
metrics.description: Records why the passwords sync failed: either due to an authentication error, unexpected exception, or other error. The error strings are truncated and sanitized to omit PII, like usernames and passwords.

metrics.name: logins_sync.finished_at
metrics.description: Records when the passwords sync finished. This includes the time to download, apply, and upload all records.

metrics.name: logins_sync.incoming
metrics.description: Records incoming passwords record counts. `applied` is the number of incoming passwords entries that were successfully stored or updated in the local database. `failed_to_apply` is the number of entries that were ignored due to errors. `reconciled` is the number of entries with changes both locally and remotely that were merged.

metrics.name: logins_sync.outgoing
metrics.description: Records outgoing passwords record counts. `uploaded` is the number of records that were successfully sent to the server. `failed_to_upload` is the number of records that weren't uploaded, and will be retried on the next sync.

metrics.name: logins_sync.outgoing_batches
metrics.description: Records the number of batches needed to upload all outgoing records. The Sync server has a hard limit on the number of records (and request body bytes) on the number of records that can fit into a single batch, and large syncs may require multiple batches.

metrics.name: logins_sync.started_at
metrics.description: Records when the passwords sync started.

metrics.name: logins_sync.uid
metrics.description: The user's hashed Firefox Account ID.

metrics.name: os
metrics.description:
The name of the operating system.
Possible values:
Android, iOS, Linux, Darwin, Windows,
FreeBSD, NetBSD, OpenBSD, Solaris, unknown

metrics.name: os_version
metrics.description:
The user-visible version of the operating system (e.g. "1.2.3"). If the
version detection fails, this metric gets set to `Unknown`.

metrics.name: pages.page_load
metrics.description: Measuring how long each page takes to load.

metrics.name: ping_reason
metrics.description:
The optional reason the ping was submitted.
The specific values for reason are specific to each ping, and are
documented in the ping's pings.yaml file.

metrics.name: reason
metrics.description:
The optional reason the ping was submitted.
The specific values for reason are specific to each ping, and are
documented in the ping's pings.yaml file.

metrics.name: searches.counts
metrics.description: Counting how many searches are queried in a specific search engine. The search engine `identifier`s are used as keys for this metric.

metrics.name: seq
metrics.description: A running counter of the number of times pings of this type have been sent

metrics.name: start_time
metrics.description:
The time of the start of collection of the data in the ping,
in local time and with minute precision, including timezone information.

metrics.name: sync.failure_reason
metrics.description: Records a global sync failure: either due to an authentication error, unexpected exception, or other error that caused the sync to fail. Error strings are truncated and sanitized to omit PII, like URLs and file system paths.

metrics.name: sync.sync_uuid
metrics.description: Unique identifier for this sync, used to correlate together individual pings for data types that were synchronized together (history, bookmarks, logins). If a data type is synchronized by itself via the legacy 'sync' API (as opposed to the Sync Manager), then this field will not be set on the corresponding ping.

metrics.name: tabs.activated
metrics.description: Number of tabs activated during a session

metrics.name: tabs.opened
metrics.description: Number of tabs opened during a session

metrics.name: url.domains
metrics.description: Counting how many domains are visited in a session.

metrics.name: url.query_type
metrics.description: Counting how many URLs are visited in a day, by input method.

metrics.name: url.visits
metrics.description: Counting how many URL links are visited in a session.

metrics.name: windows.active_in_front_time
metrics.description: In Firefox Reality, we allow maximum three windows be placed at front, left, and right positions simultaneously. Using this metric to measure how long the front side window is active in a session.

metrics.name: windows.active_in_left_time
metrics.description: In Firefox Reality, we allow maximum three windows be placed at front, left, and right positions simultaneously. Using this metric to measure how long the left side window is active in a session.

metrics.name: windows.active_in_right_time
metrics.description: In Firefox Reality, we allow maximum three windows be placed at front, left, and right positions simultaneously. Using this metric to measure how long the right side window is active in a session.

metrics.name: windows.double_pri_window_opened_time
metrics.description: Measuring how long a user uses double private windows in a session.

metrics.name: windows.double_window_opened_time
metrics.description: Measuring how long a user uses double windows in a session.

metrics.name: windows.duration
metrics.description: Measuring how long windows are kept open.

metrics.name: windows.movement
metrics.description: Counting how many times of moving a window in a session.

metrics.name: windows.opened_pri_window_count
metrics.description: Counting which multiple private window mode (single, double, triple) users are using in a session.

metrics.name: windows.opened_window_count
metrics.description: Counting which multiple window mode (single, double, triple) users are using in a session.

metrics.name: windows.resize
metrics.description: Counting how many times of resizing a window in a session.

metrics.name: windows.single_pri_window_opened_time
metrics.description: Measuring how long a user uses single private window in a session.

metrics.name: windows.single_window_opened_time
metrics.description: Measuring how long a user uses single window in a session.

metrics.name: windows.triple_pri_window_opened_time
metrics.description: Measuring how long a user uses triple private windows in a session.

metrics.name: windows.triple_window_opened_time
metrics.description: Measuring how long a user uses triple windows in a session.
